meanings.definition: In a way that is not able to exist or work together harmoniously with something else.
meanings.sent1: The two puzzle pieces fit incompatibly.
meanings.sent2: The square peg incompatibly tried to fit into the round hole.
meanings.sent3: The cat and dog incompatibly tried to share the same bed.
meanings.sent4: Her strict schedule incompatibly clashed with his spontaneous nature.
meanings.sent5: The mismatched colors incompatibly clashed in the painting.

meanings.definition: In a manner that is not suitable or consistent with something else.
meanings.sent1: She dressed incompatibly for the formal event.
meanings.sent2: His casual attitude incompatibly contrasted with the seriousness of the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The chef incompatibly added sugar instead of salt to the dish.
meanings.sent4: The loud music incompatibly disrupted the peaceful atmosphere of the library.
meanings.sent5: The conflicting opinions incompatibly collided during the debate.
